text: Hey everybody, do you know if it’s possible to point a root domain on HubSpot IP because it’s not possible to redirect root domain with CNAME ? Is HubSpot static or dynamic?
I don't believe that that is possible. you can set the root to wildcard redirect to the www (ex) with most hosts/registrars.

Thanks <@U25C65C3S>. I don’t believe to but I would like to be sure.
But a 301 redirection like <http://ideagency.fr|ideagency.fr> to www.ideagency doesn’t work if we directly access to <https://ideagency.fr>. It just OK for <http://ideagency.fr>
You would have to set up an ssl for the root domain with your hosting provider, then the redirect would work.

The problem is that to activate SSL on root domain my provider tells me that root domain and subdomain (www) must point to the same IP address. So I asked HubSpot support if it’s possible to have a HubSpot IP to point my domain on....

Hey Loic. Unfortunately HubSpot does not support secure SSL root (eg. <http://HubSpot.com|HubSpot.com>) redirection. There are some hosting providers that do support this, but it’s only a few to my knowledge.
<@U22PU4G4A>  It’s a pb because since I activate SSL on HubSpot (i’m full COS) my root domain is not reachable (<https://ideagency.fr>) and I loose suddenly all my SEO position :disappointed:
One redirect service you can look-into is <https://www.easyredir.com/> which supports secure DNS redirection and may be able to help.
